text: "Metatheory.jl is a general purpose metaprogramming and algebraic computation library for the Julia programming language, designed to take advantage of the powerful reflection capabilities to bridge the gap between symbolic mathematics, abstract interpretation, equational reasoning, optimization, composable compiler transforms, and advanced homoiconic pattern matching features."

elements.text: "Metatheory.jl is a general purpose metaprogramming and algebraic computation library for the Julia programming language, designed to take advantage of the powerful reflection capabilities to bridge the gap between symbolic mathematics, abstract interpretation, equational reasoning, optimization, composable compiler transforms, and advanced homoiconic pattern matching features."

text: <@U01K2JB9GPJ> Metatheory.jl looks really cool. Do you have a thread discussing it in detail anywhere? I'd be especially interested in tradeoffs vs SymbolicUtils.jl. I'm currently using SymbolicUtils [like this](<https://informativeprior.com/blog/2021/01-25-symbolic-simplification/>) for optimizing computations for probabilistic programming; I'd love to understand the tradeoffs in the space a little better.

attachments.title: JuliaLang
attachments.text: This is the Zulip server for the Julia programming language community. We ask anyone joining to adhere to the Julia Code of Conduct. | To learn more about Julia, check out <https://julialang.org/>, or just come ask us here! | You can reach out to the admins of this Zulip by sending a direct message to @zulip-admins.
